xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 17 April 2014
xwikidoc.content: <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips 01:32 <vijay13> has quit 04:15 <vijay13> has quit 08:04 <mcupak> has quit 12:02 <Shubham1> has quit 13:35 <Shubham1> has quit 13:47 <akats> has joined #phenotips 13:48 <akats> sdumitriu: What is the link for the phenomecentral playground? 13:48 <sdumitriu> copy. 13:52 <akats> There's a broken image when clicking on "What's this" by the Monarch score in the phenotypes selection. https://playground.phenotips.org/bin/edit/data/P0000060#HClinicalsymptomsandphysicalfindings 14:17 <vijay13> has quit 14:27 <akats> Did xwiki switch to exporting all documents (in the administration) in xar format (rather than zip) or is that something wrong with my install? 14:28 <sdumitriu> It's always been xar 14:28 <sdumitriu> Which is a zip 14:29 <akats> That's true. Nevermind. Just stopped working with my archive manager. 14:48 <akats> I don't think there are any more issue for me 14:51 <sdumitriu> Let me find something 14:52 <akats> Thanks. 14:53 <akats> By the way, does Xwiki have something like cron? 14:54 <sdumitriu> Yes 14:55 <sdumitriu> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Scheduler+Application 14:55 <sdumitriu> It is available in PhenoTips already, although the UI for it is missing 14:57 <akats> Thanks. I don't need UI. This is the only way I see of responding to requests asynchronously. 14:59 <sdumitriu> Not sure... 14:59 <sdumitriu> You should do it differently 15:00 <sdumitriu> When a request comes: 15:00 <sdumitriu> 1. Is the response expected synchronously? If yes, then search, get results, format the response, send it as a reply to the request 15:03 <akats> Well for case number 2, when the other server wants an asychronous response, I should first return a 200 response, and then send the results to the asychronous endpoint 15:03 <sdumitriu> 2: Is the response async? Yes, add a task in a queue, then return 15:04 <sdumitriu> 3: Is the response email? Same as 2 15:04 <sdumitriu> There's a queue processor which gets the tasks from queue, runs them, and based on the response type, either sends an email or makes a HTTPS request 15:05 <akats> So you're saying XWiki has a queuing processor? 15:06 <sdumitriu> No, I'm saying Java has one 15:06 <sdumitriu> Searching for it... 15:08 <akats> Oh, good old Java has everything. 15:08 <sdumitriu> http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/Executors.html 15:11 <akats> So to my understanding it just sits in a separate thread, and get's checked when nothing else is happening? 15:14 <sdumitriu> It does sit in a separate thread, but it always runs 15:17 <akats> I see, thanks 15:18 <vijay13> has quit 17:48 <mcupak> has quit 19:54 <akats> has quit
